SENT.plain: The case of a 6.5 years old boy, hospitalised because of recurrent vomiting, epigastrial, periumbilical abdominal pain, is reported

The contrast--medium swallow--x-ray examination showed no alteration, while during repeated continuous 24 hours pH monitoring of the distal esophagus, the pH values permanently were wound to remain under 4
By esophagoscopy, only moderate inflammatory signs could be detected
The long-lasting complaints and the results of pH monitoring indicated serial biopsy from the esophagus-wall
The histological finding showed gastric mucosa 2 cm above the lower esophageal sphincter, i.e. a Barrett syndrome
Upon the treatment administered according to the diagnosis, the complaints of the child considerably improved
